item.title: Announcing TypeScript 5.1 - TypeScript
item.description: Today we’re excited to announce the release of TypeScript 5.1! If you’re not yet familiar with TypeScript, it’s a language that builds on JavaScript by adding constructs called types. These types can describe some details about our program, and can be checked by TypeScript before they’re compiled away in order to catch possible typos,
item.author: (Daniel Rosenwasser)

item.title: Tree Borrows
item.description: Tree Borrows is a proposed alternative to Stacked Borrows that fulfills the same role: to define the runtime requiremenst of the aliasing constraints that pointers must follow. Execution paths that violate these constraints are declared to contain Undefined Behavior (UB) and can be assumed by the compiler to never occur. This enables optimizations that would otherwise be unsound in the presence of unsafe code.

item.title: Time abstraction in .NET 8
item.description: With the upcoming release of .NET, the team introduced an abstraction of time itself. That can bring you major benefits especially if you have to test scenarios where time is a crucial part! Until now, you had to create your own wrapper. This, of course, makes integration with 3rd party libraries tricky.
